Weaver/pkg/shell/shell.go.description: handleValidate() now uses two spinners per iteration: extractSpin for extraction step showing "Iteration N/M: Extracting 'concept'..." and analyzeSpin for analysis step showing "Iteration N/M: Analyzing N vectors...". Pattern: create spinner with iteration info, start, run operation, call Success/Fail based on result. Uses continue on failures to allow remaining iterations to proceed.

Weaver/pkg.description: Package structure follows pattern of separate directories per feature (analysis, backend, concepts, config, runtime, shell). New spinner package should be at Weaver/pkg/spinner/.

Weaver/pkg/spinner/spinner.go.description: Spinner supports non-TTY fallback mode. When output is not a terminal (piped/redirected), it prints static messages without animation or ANSI codes. TTY detection uses golang.org/x/term.IsTerminal(). Config.IsTTY (pointer to bool) allows explicit override; nil means auto-detect. In non-TTY mode: Start() prints "message..." once, Stop() is a no-op, Success/Fail print plain text like "✓ message (elapsed)" without colors.
